data.text: @socrateseyes our expert in disaster management is wasted on 'resilience' bs instead of dealing with the reality of on-the-ground logistics, and the government has its head in the sand because it can't admit climate change is happening.

@socrateseyes half of my brigade hardly use computers. It's not about the vax rate, it's about admin. Stop being so obsessed about an irrelevant issue. This is about the structure and management of emergency infrastructure and lack of response planning.

@helgztech Right ok. Well, only 29% of RFS members have upload there vax status to the members portal as required. So either only 29% wanted to, or 29% are vaxd. If that correlates across to SES then I think there’s a bigger problem here.

@socrateseyes 94% of Australians are vaccinated. So basic maths tells you that a vaccine mandate will be making a difference of 5% at most. If you're not getting help it's because the LNP couldn't manage a pissup in a brewery and doesn't give a shit.
@socrateseyes garbage, most of us are vaccinated anyway. If you think the handful of local volunteers are sufficient against an entire town under 18 feet of water you're kidding yourself.
@jasonApplegat14 @NSWRFS Can’t do that. There’s a status quo to be upheld you know. Best they could manage was 600 volunteers. Says it all.
@helgztech Because the their mandate culled substantial volunteer numbers.
@OzziePatriot @NSWRFS SES were stretched to the limit. There aren't that many of them.
